content.text:
<task>
Add `tmux` installation and configuration to the setup.

1.  **Check for existing config**: Look in `assets/` for any existing `.tmux.conf` or similar.
2.  **Create Config**: If none exists, create a sensible default `tmux.conf` in `assets/` that integrates well with the terminal (e.g., mouse support, true color, status bar).
3.  **Update Script**: Modify `scripts/core_setup.sh` (or create `scripts/tmux_setup.sh` if you prefer, but core seems fine) to:
    *   Install `tmux` via package manager.
    *   Symlink or copy the `tmux.conf` to the user's home directory (or `~/.config/tmux/`).
4.  **Verify**: Ensure the script runs without errors.
</task>

<environment_details>

content.thinking:
The user wants me to add tmux installation and configuration to their setup. Let me break this down:

1. Check for existing tmux config in assets/
2. Create a sensible default tmux.conf if none exists
3. Update scripts/core_setup.sh to install tmux and symlink the config
4. Verify the script runs without errors

Let me first check if there's any existing tmux config in assets/, and also read the core_setup.sh to understand the current structure.

content.text:
<read_file>
<args>
<file>
<path>scripts/core_setup.sh</path>
</file>
</args>
</read_file>
[read_file for 'scripts/core_setup.sh'. Reading multiple files at once is more efficient for the LLM. If other files are relevant to your current task, please read them simultaneously.] Result:

<files>
<file><path>scripts/core_setup.sh</path>
<content lines="1-188">
  1 | #!/bin/bash
  2 | # =============================================================================
  3 | # core_setup.sh - Core system setup: packages, shell, fonts, dotfiles
  4 | # =============================================================================
  5 | 
  6 | set -e
  7 | 
  8 | # Source common utilities
  9 | SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
 10 | source "$SCRIPT_DIR/common.sh"
 11 | 
 12 | check_not_root
 13 | verify_backup_dir
 14 | 
 15 | # =============================================================================
 16 | # System Update
 17 | # =============================================================================
 18 | log_section "Updating system..."
 19 | sudo dnf update -y
 20 | log_success "System updated"
 21 | 
 22 | # =============================================================================
 23 | # Install Core Packages
 24 | # =============================================================================
 25 | log_section "Installing core packages..."
 26 | 
 27 | CORE_PACKAGES=(
 28 |     zsh
 29 |     git
 30 |     curl
 31 |     wget
 32 |     util-linux-user
 33 |     fastfetch
 34 |     kitty
 35 |     podman
 36 |     podman-compose
 37 | )
 38 | 
 39 | dnf_install "${CORE_PACKAGES[@]}"
 40 | log_success "Core packages installed"
 41 | 
 42 | # =============================================================================
 43 | # Install Starship
 44 | # =============================================================================
 45 | log_section "Installing Starship..."
 46 | if dnf_install starship 2>/dev/null; then
 47 |     log_success "Starship installed via dnf"
 48 | else
 49 |     log_warn "Starship not in repos, installing via official script..."
 50 |     curl -sS https://starship.rs/install.sh | sh -s -- -y
 51 |     log_success "Starship installed via official script"
 52 | fi
 53 | 
 54 | # =============================================================================
 55 | # Install Atuin
 56 | # =============================================================================
 57 | log_section "Installing Atuin..."
 58 | if dnf_install atuin 2>/dev/null; then
 59 |     log_success "Atuin installed via dnf"
 60 | else
 61 |     log_warn "Atuin not in repos, installing via official script..."
 62 |     curl --proto '=https' --tlsv1.2 -sSf https://setup.atuin.sh | bash
 63 |     log_success "Atuin installed via official script"
 64 | fi
 65 | 
 66 | # =============================================================================
 67 | # Install Zsh Plugins
 68 | # =============================================================================
 69 | log_section "Installing Zsh plugins..."
 70 | dnf_install zsh-autosuggestions zsh-syntax-highlighting
 71 | log_success "zsh-autosuggestions and zsh-syntax-highlighting installed"
 72 | 
 73 | # zsh-autocomplete
 74 | ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_SYSTEM="/usr/share/zsh-autocomplete/zsh-autocomplete.plugin.zsh"
 75 | ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL="$HOME/.local/share/zsh/plugins/zsh-autocomplete"
 76 | 
 77 | if dnf_install zsh-autocomplete 2>/dev/null && [[ -f "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_SYSTEM" ]]; then
 78 |     log_success "zsh-autocomplete installed via dnf"
 79 | else
 80 |     log_warn "zsh-autocomplete not in repos, cloning from GitHub..."
 81 |     ensure_dir "$HOME/.local/share/zsh/plugins"
 82 |     rm -rf "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL" 2>/dev/null || true
 83 |     git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/marlonrichert/zsh-autocomplete.git "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL"
 84 |     log_success "zsh-autocomplete cloned to $ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL"
 85 | fi
 86 | 
 87 | # =============================================================================
 88 | # Restore Dotfiles
 89 | # =============================================================================
 90 | log_section "Restoring dotfiles..."
 91 | 
 92 | # .zshrc
 93 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/.zshrc" ]]; then
 94 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/.zshrc" ~/
 95 |     # Update zsh-autocomplete path if using local installation
 96 |     if [[ ! -f "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_SYSTEM" ]] && [[ -d "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL" ]]; then
 97 |         sed -i "s|source /usr/share/zsh-autocomplete/zsh-autocomplete.plugin.zsh|source $ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL/zsh-autocomplete.plugin.zsh|g" ~/.zshrc
 98 |         log_success ".zshrc copied and updated with local zsh-autocomplete path"
 99 |     else
100 |         log_success ".zshrc copied"
101 |     fi
102 | fi
103 | 
104 | # .bashrc
105 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/.bashrc" ]]; then
106 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/.bashrc" ~/
107 |     log_success ".bashrc copied"
108 | fi
109 | 
110 | # .gitconfig
111 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/.gitconfig" ]]; then
112 |     if [[ -f ~/.gitconfig ]]; then
113 |         cp ~/.gitconfig ~/.gitconfig.backup
114 |         log_warn "Existing .gitconfig backed up"
115 |     fi
116 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/.gitconfig" ~/
117 |     log_success ".gitconfig copied"
118 | fi
119 | 
120 | # =============================================================================
121 | # Restore .config directories
122 | # =============================================================================
123 | log_section "Restoring .config directories..."
124 | ensure_dir ~/.config
125 | 
126 | # starship.toml
127 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/starship/starship.toml" ]]; then
128 |     ensure_dir ~/.config/starship
129 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/starship/starship.toml" ~/.config/starship/
130 |     log_success "starship.toml copied"
131 | elif [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/starship.toml" ]]; then
132 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/starship.toml" ~/.config/
133 |     log_success "starship.toml copied"
134 | fi
135 | 
136 | # atuin config
137 | if [[ -d "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/atuin" ]]; then
138 |     copy_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/atuin" ~/.config/atuin
139 | fi
140 | 
141 | # fastfetch config
142 | if [[ -d "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/fastfetch" ]]; then
143 |     copy_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/fastfetch" ~/.config/fastfetch
144 | fi
145 | 
146 | # fastfetch custom logo
147 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/images/jedi.png" ]]; then
148 |     ensure_dir ~/.config/fastfetch/assets
149 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/images/jedi.png" ~/.config/fastfetch/assets/
150 |     log_success "fastfetch custom logo (jedi.png) copied"
151 | fi
152 | 
153 | # fish config
154 | if [[ -d "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/fish" ]]; then
155 |     copy_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/fish" ~/.config/fish
156 | fi
157 | 
158 | # kitty config
159 | if [[ -d "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/kitty" ]]; then
160 |     copy_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/kitty" ~/.config/kitty
161 | fi
162 | 
163 | # =============================================================================
164 | # Install Fonts
165 | # =============================================================================
166 | log_section "Installing fonts..."
167 | if [[ -d "$BACKUP_DIR/fonts" ]]; then
168 |     ensure_dir ~/.local/share/fonts
169 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/fonts/"*.ttf ~/.local/share/fonts/ 2>/dev/null || true
170 |     fc-cache -fv
171 |     log_success "Fonts installed and cache updated"
172 | else
173 |     log_warn "No fonts directory found in backup"
174 | fi
175 | 
176 | # =============================================================================
177 | # Change Default Shell to Zsh
178 | # =============================================================================
179 | log_section "Setting default shell to Zsh..."
180 | ZSH_PATH="$(which zsh)"
181 | if [[ "$SHELL" != "$ZSH_PATH" ]]; then
182 |     chsh -s "$ZSH_PATH"
183 |     log_success "Default shell changed to zsh (takes effect on next login)"
184 | else
185 |     log_success "Zsh is already the default shell"
186 | fi
187 | 
188 | log_section "Core setup complete!"
</content>
</file>
</files>

content.thinking:
No existing tmux config found. I need to:
1. Create a new tmux.conf in assets/.config/tmux/
2. Update core_setup.sh to install tmux and copy the config

Let me create a sensible default tmux config and update the script.

content.text:
No existing tmux config found. I'll create a sensible default config and update the setup script.

<write_to_file>
<path>assets/.config/tmux/tmux.conf</path>
<content># =============================================================================
# tmux Configuration
# =============================================================================

# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# General Settings
# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Enable true color support
set -g default-terminal "tmux-256color"
set -ga terminal-overrides ",*256col*:Tc"

# Enable mouse support
set -g mouse on

# Start windows and panes at 1, not 0
set -g base-index 1
setw -g pane-base-index 1

# Renumber windows when one is closed
set -g renumber-windows on

# Increase history limit
set -g history-limit 50000

# Faster key repetition
set -s escape-time 0

# Enable focus events
set -g focus-events on

# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Key Bindings
# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Change prefix to Ctrl-a (more ergonomic than Ctrl-b)
unbind C-b
set -g prefix C-a
bind C-a send-prefix

# Reload config
bind r source-file ~/.config/tmux/tmux.conf \; display "Config reloaded!"

# Split panes using | and -
bind | split-window -h -c "#{pane_current_path}"
bind - split-window -v -c "#{pane_current_path}"
unbind '"'
unbind %

# Navigate panes with vim keys
bind h select-pane -L
bind j select-pane -D
bind k select-pane -U
bind l select-pane -R

# Resize panes with vim keys
bind -r H resize-pane -L 5
bind -r J resize-pane -D 5
bind -r K resize-pane -U 5
bind -r L resize-pane -R 5

# New window in current path
bind c new-window -c "#{pane_current_path}"

# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Status Bar
# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Status bar position
set -g status-position bottom

# Status bar style
set -g status-style 'bg=#1e1e2e fg=#cdd6f4'

# Status bar left
set -g status-left-length 40
set -g status-left '#[fg=#89b4fa,bold]  #S #[default]â”‚ '

# Status bar right
set -g status-right-length 100
set -g status-right '#[fg=#a6adc8]#{?client_prefix,#[fg=#f9e2af]PREFIX ,}#[fg=#89dceb]%H:%M #[fg=#94e2d5]%Y-%m-%d '

# Window status
set -g window-status-format '#[fg=#6c7086] #I:#W '
set -g window-status-current-format '#[fg=#f5c2e7,bold] #I:#W '

# Pane borders
set -g pane-border-style 'fg=#45475a'
set -g pane-active-border-style 'fg=#89b4fa'

# Message style
set -g message-style 'bg=#313244 fg=#cdd6f4'

# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Copy Mode (Vi style)
# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

setw -g mode-keys vi
bind -T copy-mode-vi v send -X begin-selection
bind -T copy-mode-vi y send -X copy-pipe-and-cancel 'xclip -in -selection clipboard'
</content>
<line_count>98</line_count>
</write_to_file>
